title: Greg Burke (rugby league)
text:
Greg Burke is an English <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a or for the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Super%20League">Betfred Super League</a>.
He played for the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and on loan from <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> at the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> and <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the Super League and <a href="Workington%20Town">Workington Town</a> in the <a href="2014%20RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>. Burke played for the <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a> in the top flight, and on loan from <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> at <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>, before joining the <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Red Devils</a> permanently in <a href="2019%20Super%20League%20season">2019</a>.
Background.
Burke was born in <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a>, <a href="Greater%20Manchester">Greater Manchester</a>, England.
Wigan Warriors.
He featured in 17 games in 2013 scoring one try against <a href="Catalans%20Dragons">Catalans Dragons</a>. He missed out on the play-off games and the Grand Final. During 2014 he was not selected for the <a href="2014%20World%20Club%20Challenge">2014 World Club Challenge</a> but he did play 6 league games. Burke returned to Wigan for the 2016 season and featured in 19 games for the Warriors, before departing to join Widnes in the summer.
Loan to Bradford Bulls.
Burke signed on a one-month loan deal at the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in 2014. He featured in Round 4 (<a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a>) in which he sustained a dislocated shoulder.
Loan to Hull KR.
In November 2014, Burke signed for <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> on loan for the 2015 season, making 21 appearances throughout the season.
Salford.
He played in the <a href="2019%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2019 Super League Grand Final</a> defeat by <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St Helens</a> at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.
On 17 October 2020, he played in the <a href="2020%20Challenge%20Cup%20Final">2020 Challenge Cup Final</a> defeat for Salford against Leeds at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>.
